meanings.definition: Fluorins (noun): A chemical element with the symbol F and atomic number 9.
meanings.sent1: I learned about fluorins in my science class.
meanings.sent2: The chemist studied the properties of fluorins.
meanings.sent3: The fluorins were having a party in the periodic table.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of fluorins was as clear as a glass of water.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of fluorins stood out among the elements.

meanings.definition: Fluorins (adjective): Relating to or containing fluorine.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted experiments with fluorins compounds.
meanings.sent2: The dentist used fluorins toothpaste for better oral health.
meanings.sent3: The fluorins solution sparkled like a diamond under the light.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as fluorins when she heard the good news.
meanings.sent5: The fluorins coating protected the metal from corrosion.

meanings.definition: Fluorins (verb): To treat or combine with fluorine.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to fluorins the water to make it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: She fluorinsed the glassware before conducting the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The chef fluorinsed the vegetables to preserve their freshness.
meanings.sent4: His words fluorinsed her heart with hope.
meanings.sent5: The scientist fluorinsed the sample to analyze its composition.
